findings.description: All 6 TDD anchor tests from task spec are covered: testSaveAndRetrieveMnemonic, testSaveAndRetrievePrivateKeys, testPasswordHashStorage ($2a$12$ prefix verified), testClearAllRemovesData, testKeystoreCorruptionHandling (clearAll called + error message verified), testMultipleReadWriteCycles

Good use of in-memory dataStore map to simulate SharedPreferences behavior. Tests are testing actual storage logic (serialization, key management, null handling) rather than just mocking return values.
Edge cases well covered: partial keys (only BTC or ETH saved), empty storage, empty string as valid value, default chain ID, hasWallet state. Each edge case is a separate focused test.

Corruption tests verify both the thrown exception message AND that clearAll() was called (via editor.clear() verification). This ensures the spec requirement of 'clear corrupted storage' is actually enforced.

16 additional tests beyond the 6 TDD anchors provide comprehensive coverage: null returns for unset data, space-separated storage format verification, WalletConnect sessions, active chain ID, hasWallet checks.

summary: All 22 tests pass. All 6 required TDD anchor tests from the task specification are present and correctly implemented. Tests use meaningful assertions that test actual storage behavior, not just mock returns. Edge cases (partial keys, empty values, corruption on all getters) are well covered. Test structure follows Arrange-Act-Assert pattern with clear, descriptive names.
